page.title: 05Chorley. A General Review 1
page.content: The houses are mainly terraced,many of Accrington brick.There is some semi-detached, council and privately owned housing.Along Eaves Lane,as well as different types of shops, there is an old 'Work House',which is about one hundred years old. To-day this is a hospital and is used mainly for mentally retarded and old people. A useful recent addition to the area is the Tatton Community Centre. At Hartwood roundabout,oon the North side of Chorley several roads meet: The A674 goes to Blackburn. The M61 and A6 lead Northwards to Preston. and Southwards to Manchester. The Blackpool/Manchester railway line passes here. Also at Hartwood there is a modern Hospital complex and a Hotel.
